content: कर्मन् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [कृ-मनिन् <ls>Uṇ. 4. 144</ls>] {@--1@} Action, work, deed. {@--2@} Execution, performance. {@--3@} Business, office, duty; संप्रति विषवैद्यानां कर्म <ls>M. 4.</ls> {@--4@} A religious rite (it may be either नित्य, नैमित्तिक or काम्य). {@--5@} A specific action, moral duty. {@--6@} ({%a%}) Performance of religious rites as opposed to speculative religion or knowledge of Brahman (<ab>opp.</ab> ज्ञान); <ls>R. 8. 20.</ls> ({%b%}) Labour, work. {@--7@} Product, result. {@--8@} A natural or active property (as support of the earth). {@--9@} Fate, the certain consequence of acts done in a former life; कर्मायत्तं फलं पुंसां बुद्धिः कर्मानुसारिणी <ls>Bh. 2. 89</ls>, <ls n="Bh. 2.">94.</ls> {@--10@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) The object of an action; कर्तुरीप्सिततमं कर्म <ls>P. I. 4. 49.</ls> {@--11@} (In <ls>Vaiś.</ls> <ab>phil.</ab>) Motion considered as one of the seven categories of things; thus defined: --एकद्रव्यमगुणं संयोगविभोगष्वनपेक्षकारणं कर्म <ls>Vaiś. Sūt.</ls> (It is five-fold:-- उत्क्षेपणं ततोऽवक्षेपणमाकुंचनं तथा . प्रसारणं च गमनं कर्मांण्येतानि पंच च .. <ls>Bhāṣā P. 6.</ls>) {@--12@} Organ of sense. {@--13@} (In <ab>astr.</ab>) The tenth lunar mansion.
